We provide a number of payment options to suit your situation, when arranging your insurances with us. Our payment options include:

Monthly Instalments via Premium Funding

With most insurance policies, you have the flexibility to pay the insurance cost through monthly instalments via Premium Funding.
Some of the key benefits of premium funding are:

  1. Improved cash flow – no lump sum payments which allows more working capital for other income generating opportunities
  2. Tax Deductible – interest payable on premium funding is tax deductible for businesses*
  3. Competitively priced – interest rates are very competitive compared with other forms of finance
  4. Flexibility – multiple payment options available (including Visa, Mastercard, Amex)
  5. Doesn’t Interfere with existing finance, including Bank Overdrafts.

Please contact our office to arrange this option. Please note, interest and administration fees apply.
*We recommend confirming the tax deductibility of premium funding with your accountant or tax agent before proceeding, to confirm your eligibility.

Credit & Debit Card Payments

For your convenience, you can pay your premium using your preferred credit or debit card:

VISA M/C AMEX
To ensure that your payment is secure, click HERE to be directed to Insurance Advisernet Head Office website. Please use your Invoice Number without the first character, “I”, from the Tax Invoice we have provided to you.

Merchant Fees apply as per the Insurance Advisernet website.
You can also call our credit card payment line on 77 8997 7378.

BPAY or Direct Deposit/EFT

Contact your participating financial institution to make a payment from your cheque, savings or credit card account.

Biller Code: 485326
Reference: Please refer the front of your Tax Invoice for your BPAY reference number

If you wish to pay via EFT, please contact us for Insurance Advisernet’s Bank Details.

Cheque/ Money Orders

If your wish to pay via Cheque, please contact us for Insurance Advisernet’s postal address.
